Class PrepController

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Controller.Controller
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Controller.PrepController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ControllerHourGlassListener
public class PrepController extends Controller implements ControllerHourGlassListener
The PrepController class represents the preparation phase in the game's lifecycle. It extends the Controller class and implements the ControllerHourGlassListener interface to handle specific events and states related to the preparation phase of a player. During this phase, players configure or modify their game resources and transition to subsequent states based on their setup's validity.

      public PrepController(Player currentPlayer, String gameId, GameController gc, boolean disconnected)
      Constructor for the PrepController class responsible for initializing and setting up the game state for the preparation phase.
      Parameters:
      currentPlayer - The current player object that represents the player in the game.
      gameId - The unique identifier for the game session.
      gc - The GameController instance managing the game logic.
      disconnected - A boolean flag indicating if the player is disconnected.

    • nextState

      public void nextState(GameController gc)
      Transitions the game to the next state based on the current player's actions and game board validity. Handles reconnection scenarios, validates the player's board state, and updates the game controller with the appropriate controller for the next game phase.
      Specified by:
      nextState in class Controller
      Parameters:
      gc - the GameController instance that manages the overall game state and interactions

    • onFinish

      public void onFinish()
      Triggered when the hourglass timer finishes. This method is responsible for transitioning players who have not marked themselves as ready to a state where they can only issue the "Finish Building" command. The method performs the following actions: - Prints a log message indicating that the hourglass has finished. - Synchronizes on the game controller instance to ensure thread safety. - Iterates over all players in the game. - For each player who is not ready (checked via the `GetReady` method), transitions their state to `ChoosePosition` using the
      Specified by:
      onFinish in interface ControllerHourGlassListener

    • hourglassUpdate

      public void hourglassUpdate(HourglassEvent event)
      Updates the state or logic of the controller based on the provided hourglass event. Typically used to handle specific timing or state changes related to an hourglass event in the game.
      Specified by:
      hourglassUpdate in interface ControllerHourGlassListener
      Parameters:
      event - the HourglassEvent containing information about the event, including a message and whether the hourglass has started.
